title: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'medacy.ner'
body:
#### Description

while installing medaCy_model_clinical_notes, the following error is thrown,

    Complete output (9 lines):
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
      File "C:\Users\Saumitra\AppData\Local\Temp\pip-req-build-td8r2nuh\setup.py", line 3, in <module>
        from medacy_model_clinical_notes import __version__, __authors__
      File "C:\Users\Saumitra\AppData\Local\Temp\pip-req-build-td8r2nuh\medacy_model_clinical_notes\__init__.py", line 1, in <module>
        from .medacy_model_clinical_notes import load
      File "C:\Users\Saumitra\AppData\Local\Temp\pip-req-build-td8r2nuh\medacy_model_clinical_notes\medacy_model_clinical_notes.py", line 3, in <module>
        from medacy.ner.pipelines import ClinicalPipeline
    **ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'medacy.ner'**

#### Steps/Code to Reproduce
running pip install git+https://github.com/NLPatVCU/medaCy_model_clinical_notes.git

#### Versions

Platform : Windows-10-10.0.18362-SP0
Python : Python  3.6.8 |Anaconda, Inc.| (default, Feb 21 2019, 18:30:04) [MSC v.1916 64 bit (AMD64)]
Numpy : Numpy  1.17.4
Scipy : Scipy  1.3.1
Medacy : medacy  0.2.0

I have installed medaCy through the development branch.

Is the medaCy.ner module to be downloaded and installed seperately.


<!-- Thanks for contributing! -->
